required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mobile Health Intervention for Family Smoking Cessation in Romania
clinical_study.official_title: Mobile Health Intervention for Family Smoking Cessation in Romania

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are to determine in a randomized controlled trial (RCT) whether a mHealth couples intervention shows promise in increasing smoking cessation among pregnant couples who smoke and to build mHealth research capacity in Romania. The intervention will be novel in its use of the unique functionality of smartphones, its emphasis on the dyadic efficacy for smoking cessation, and the focus on pregnant couples. Our aims are to (1) Test the implementation feasibility, acceptability, and initial efficacy of a culturally-adapted mHealth smoking cessation intervention among couples during pregnancy and postpartum in Romania. (2) Develop mHealth research capacity by enhancing individual and institutional research capabilities in Romania and expanding the existing international research network.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of women in each arm who stopped smoking, and who relapsed smoking postpartum
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from smoking at baseline to quitting assessed at 3 months after the intervention is completed
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcomes are maternal pregnancy smoking cessation and postnatal relapse. Maternal smoking status will be biochemically verified at the final follow-up based on salivary cotinine obtained by mail.

arm_group.description: The intervention will consist of participants will only use a smoking cessation app
The intervention will consist of participants will only use telemedicine counseling
The intervention will consist of participants will only use a smoking cessation app + telemedicine counseling
The participants will continue with usual care

intervention.description: Pregnant smokers and their life partners will use a smoking cessation app.

intervention.intervention_name: Smoke Free Together - Telemedicine counseling only
intervention.description: Pregnant smokers and their life partners will use telemedicine, real time video counseling on smoking cessation
Pregnant smokers and their life partners will use telemedicine and an app for smoking cessation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pregnant smokers in the 2nd or 3rd pregnancy trimester and their partners.
- 18 years or older
- married or in a stable relationship
- owns and uses an Android smartphone with broadband internet connection
- willing to have the partner contacted for participation.
Exclusion Criteria:
-
